title: Open House
segmentation: Good evening everybody.
Thanks also from our side for having us here at this amazingly inspiring conference today.
And also the fair and the talks yesterday.

My name is Sebastian Benari and I'm a German architect currently based in Rotterdam and I'm here to represent what my partner Vinson my models and we call eventually mate since we met at the table Berlin in 2011 and 12 where we.

To do a Bachelor thesis together and since then decided to continue working on different projects and it's at the moment the kind of remote collaborations and see is based in New York and couldn't be here tonight.
I would like to introduce what we call open house and there are many different reasons for us to show this project tonight.
First of all, it's a spinoff of my master thesis at the table, Delft, which was.
Very much intrigued by the fascination around DIY as a social cultural phenomenon.
It started as a esthetical examination of how things are made unprofessional E from and from an expert POV.
At the same time, it's also.
Proposing operational method of how we see ourselves as architects in the future.
So open House tries to connect the idea of an open house as a event where you can see or you have an insight in how people are actually working professionally on every day level.
On the other side, it's trying to enhance the Accessibility of the profession to the public as an actual drop incentive for.
For domestic production, so it's a lot about DIY tonight for the next 10 minutes I guess.
So this is our main.
Collage we also had on the on the application for the for the open call.

And it's a bit of a trigger or provocative idea to almost switch the learning by doing fact into doing by learning, because we think that it might be by like a symbiotic effect of of learning from the amateurs and trying to adapt to to intervene.
How things can be done more intuitively than over thought so?
Since we also think about open house as a platform or as a digital domain, this presentation will be structured along of how how the website could look in the future or the application.
So I will I will introduce.
405 different.

Operation modes that we think about for this for this proposal, and we think that well at the moment it's still a hypothetical idea, but we are about to apply with the idea at the Creative Fund in the Netherlands to give it a push and to make it an actual actual space.
So.
We talk about the future of architecture, so excuse the almost retro retro style photo of how the architects sits in his office and being quite isolated or still.
I mean, as long as we're not among us.
Still, rather physically detached from what the public can see of our daily work.
So in this, together with the.
Mentioned fascination or the.
The culture of doing it yourself and.
All the facilities around it like DIY manuals, instructions, video tutorials, hardware stores, so things that are rather taken for granted in Western societies.
But we would like to enforce them and.
Try to make it an architectural issue somehow and try to connect.
These two words.
So what do you think about at the moment of four different functions of the open House model?
So the main idea is to have an actual space, which might be, which should be in an urban context.
We're still about to release Canon map allocation for it.

So we think about it as amenity as a design consultancy as an open space where people can access during opening hours so it's Facebook and people can come with a certain problem over the certain idea too.
To get help to get support.
To get professional knowledge.
To actually realize these projects around their house.
So everything I'm talking about tonight is.
Very specific type of client till we talk about private clients who have a.
An interest in realizing their own ambitions, but we need a different level of support through through us in this case.
So this diagram is supposed to show the four different levels, but in the next slide.
So we'll talk.
About more how how we see them.
Realized so the 1st.
Might be the actually spontaneous visit of people who have the need or need.
The log of information too.
To change their house to change their domestic condition.
So of course there must be there must be a matrix of how people are related to.
To the DIY, there's a different level of competence.
Competence is experience, financial situations.
Living conditions of course.
So how we see it is that people come with an idea.
We tried to quite.
Rapidly come up with a proposal of what they could actually change.
With site visits with photographs.
With all the material that they provide for us.
So this is a like a collage of how we we also show at the fair.
About these meetings could actually look, so it's still a rather graphical stage of the project in general, but it's supposed to offer what?
What we would like to do in the future?
So for us, the whole relationship between the client or and declined in the architect would deserve some.
A bit less of a distance, so we try to get closer to the people that we actually would like to work for.
On any different level that is related to the do-it-yourself movement.
So in this case.
Might be a rather immediate exchange of ideas and proposals and reactions to continue the project further on.
And then we also think about almost emergency situation where people are about to.
Do the project already, but then they would need some help over.
Sorry rather rather suddenly, so there's always a chance of an availability that we offer almost like a almost like a like a like a hospital loss, or like a pharmacy related to.
Architectural problems.
So I'm.
That's a favor that we do to ourselves, but we will see.
So.
We would also like to introduce different clientele and demographic perspectives.
So it's first of all, of course it's made for for everyone who is basically well with owning a house or is at least that allowed to do some transformations or changes with their own property.
So.
In this case it's.
Well, we tried to come up with a with a private private collection of materials and we could.
We could offer to redesign the storage for for these objects.

Well, there's another kind of rather techie version of the open House doing doing well not doing the open hours, but when when things are closed that we actually tried to install kind of vending machine for recipes for manuals for as an archive of all these ideas that have been come into the House but at the same time we tried to always translate ideas and projects into documentations of how these things have come to life and how.
Other people are able to benefit from there from other peoples experience, so it's a very still a very idealistic social.
Approach, so we're quite happy about the name of the panel actually, but power to the people because it's quite literally.
What we would like to do, but still without.
Getting rid of our professional.
Standpoint, so also the idea that you have that you might have.
Certain certain kind of material or.
Leftovers or things in your house that you would like to recycle or reuse.
There will be a lot of inspiration.
And coming from this machine that we tried to produce in advance to make accessible for the public so this whole process will be an ongoing.
Event of improving of collecting of.
This solving projects into ingredients into manuals and different steps and how to.
In a way professionalize the amateur.
But on the other hand, also learning from the amateur as a professional, how to do things more, more spontaneously more intuitively, more.
Or simply maybe?
So as I said, I would also think about it as a digital catalog as an online platform where.
You can apply from home if it's not an urgent situation.
So depending on your.
Ability to do things on your own.
You need a very specific support.
Maybe also for legal issues or for things that you just might not know.
So we try to help in every.
And everywhere we can, depending on what people bring inside and what can we make of it?
So in this case, if it's a handyman who has some experience and has a catalog of plants, we would just figure out.
How to do this legally and how we can document it with models, collages, plants and so on?
So in through this through this direct contact between the client and the architect.
We hope that things might also.
Speed up, but at the same time also improved the communication between.
Between our sites so.
This is our main.
Oh man, focus on these collaborations.
So through all these 4 upper modes of operation, we tried to build up a catalog of of Department of related to DIY as a.
As a domain.

So we try to create an overview of different different types that people that people might look up on the Internet, but at the same time also in form of a book or in front of a catalog or archive in the open house as well.
And yeah, this is like as I said, an ongoing meddling project is in itself.
So almost as a summary already, this is how we imagine how it is embedded in the Community or in the networks of material cultures of suppliers of people of democracies.
So what we try to do is.
By making this knowledge about practical stuff so available, we would like to.

To foster the community or the feeling of a community in a local context by defining a certain identity through these objects that are created privately, but also publicly for public furniture and so on, we would like to integrate designers others than ourselves into the whole process so.
As we believe that architecture is relevant in all different layers, we talk about DIY.
So we also talk about.
Product design sometimes, so we have to, first of all widen our or field of interest.
At the same time, we need to collaborate with suppliers too.
To tackle a bit the material economy and to see how we can work with materials that are available that are maybe over produced so we can so we can reuse them anyway.
So talking about the actual location of our our proposal, which is still under discussion.
We see it definitely in a vacant spot in the local context and Central Europe, probably in well, ideally in Rotterdam, or at least in another lens.
Because we think that there is a, there's a big culture of.
Up this phenomenon, at least that's what we observed, both being from Germany every day as well.
So we would like to intervene in a very small.
Almost like a retail street, so where people have the daily access to to visit us and come over.
OK, I didn't see the five, but that's OK.
So yeah, we would.
So next to next to being the main our main clients as the amateurs of course would like to to integrate craftspeople as well.
So we're trying to create this network of people surrounded.
It's about the open house, So what is left behind is actually as the architect in the center of this whole project, so we see it as a very.
Yeah, as a as a Center for consult architecture.
As for private construction because we think that the future of architecture is supposed to be.
Public open available.
Open source and bit more Democratic.
Thank you.
